results.title: Basketball for girls
results.creator_credit: Jean Halliday, Lex Halliday and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description: This film shows basketball as a game of skill based on cooperative team play. It is presented in eleven sequences to enable discussion and clarification of the points in each. A short description of the game follows, then particular aspects are fully explained and demonstrated. Common faults are shown and the necessity for regular practice of court system is stressed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean Halliday, Lex Halliday and Australian Instructional Films

results.title: Basketball clinic
results.creator_credit: Brendan McKenna, Dick Jones and Seven Network Limited (Australia)
results.brief_description: This film shows a judicious selection of situations from games of basketball played in Melbourne, using stills, action replays, etc to provide excellent illustrations of playing areas, fouls, and shooting and rebounding skills. It is recommended for use with students who have basic proficiency in basketball.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brendan McKenna, Dick Jones and Seven Network Limited (Australia)

results.title: Basic woodwork: Preparing the wood
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”.
After explaining the need for making a rough sketch and dimensional drawings of the article to be made, this film goes on to explain the drawing up of a cutting list of the sizes of the various pieces of wood required for the job.

results.title: Basic skills of women's basketball
results.brief_description: This films uses slow motion and still photography to demonstrate the necessary skills required for women’s basketball. Skills dealt with include passing, catching, dodging, foot work, goal shooting and intercepting. No other credits available.

results.title: Basic metalwork: soft soldering. Pt. 2
results.brief_description: An explanation of the fundamentals of soldering. Looks at joints relying on capillary action, preparation of ‘killed spirits’, the prevention of corrosion and the use of resin flux. No other credits available.

results.title: Basic metalwork: soft soldering. Pt. 1
results.brief_description: An explanation of the fundamentals of soldering. Fluxes and the principles of tinning and sweating; choice of bit; preparing the bit; joints relying on capillary action; preparation of “killed spirits” and the prevention of corrosion and use of resin in flux. No other credits available.
